page.title: 17THE BENTALL PLOUGH
page.content: In the late eighteenth century William Bentall established his engineering works in Goldhanger.At first he only mae small items for his own farm and those of his neighbours, but around the turn of the century he was able to expand his business and he was forced to move to new premises in the nearby river town of Heybridge.The reason for this expansion was the invention of what became known as the "Bentall Plough".He managed to find a way of successfully bolting the cast iron plough to the wooden frame and created a plough which was more durable than itd predecessors.The fame of the plough spread throughout East Anglia and the expression "to bentall the land" was in common use.The firm remained in Heybridge until l984 when it was forced to close thus closing a chapter in the history of the area.
